Overcrowding in cities: With a larger population, cities will become more crowded, leading to overcrowding in schools, hospitals, and other public facilities. This will also lead to increased traffic congestion and air pollution.
Increased pressure on the job market: The doubling of the population will put pressure on the job market, leading to increased competition for jobs and higher unemployment rates.
Increased strain on the economy: The doubling of the population will also put a strain on the economy, leading to increased inflation and a higher cost of living.
Increased demand for housing: With a larger population, there will be an increased demand for housing, leading to higher housing prices and a shortage of affordable housing options.
Increased pressure on the environment: The doubling of the population will put a strain on the environment, leading to increased deforestation, water pollution, and air pollution.
